revised_title: Disproving the Maxwell-Boltzmann Doctrine Regarding Distribution of Kinetic Energy
tldr: The author presents a test-case disproving the Maxwell-Boltzmann doctrine, which states that the average kinetic energy of two given portions of a system must be in the ratio of the number of degrees of freedom of those portions. This test-case challenges the assumption that temperature of a solid or liquid is equal to its average kinetic energy per atom, which has been widely taught and used as a fundamental proposition in thermodynamics.
